name: Hotel d'Argouges

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Staying at the Hotel d'Argouges is a delightful French experience. It is in an old building which has been renovated retaining some of the original stonework including the checker-board parlour floor, front staircase and front garden wall. The parlour is decorated in the traditional style and is tres chic. The gardens are landscaped with roses and bright annuals. The roses were in bloom when I was there and their fragrance filled the air.
reviews.title: Charming Old Chateau

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Frederic is very helpful and efficient, he was able to arrange a Canadian tour for me on very short notice. While I was on the tour my luggage was securely stowed away in a locked area. The hotel staff spoke English.
reviews.title: Absolutely marvelous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My room was in a "little house" in the front yard which featured a spiral staircase. It was decorated in shades of burgundy and gold. I found the colours and patterns very restful. The bed was very comfortable with a thick fluffly duvet and a mattress that was just soft enough. The room was spacious by European standards and very quiet. I am an older woman who travels alone and security is very important to me. I felt very safe in this hotel and in the city of Bayeux.
reviews.title: If you're visiting the Normandy Beaches, this is the place to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed 3 nights but wished we could have stayed longer.
reviews.title: Terrific, charming hotel in the center of Bayeux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were all wonderful, welcoming, friendly and so helpful at all times. The hotel is a mini-chateau and we were treated like royalty! Our rooms were extremely comfortable, airy and delightful. We would have preferred a shower rather than bath as our friends had but that was only a minor inconvenience. We also thoroughly enjoyed drinks and hors d'oeuvres in the garden. The large selection at the excellent breakfast buffet was a wonderful way to begin our days.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Bayeux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Do not be fooled by the beautiful house on their website as the chance of staying in this house is remote. At first when checking in you are brought into this beautifully presented house, the interior is very striking and we were very much looking forward to our stay. We were brought back down the earth very quickly when we were ushered out the back and pointed in the direction of a converted shed which houses 20 of the 32 rooms that the Hotel d’Argouges boasts to having. Not alone were to spend the next 2 nights of our stay in this annex, the lady owner didn’t even have the courtesy to show us to our room. She literally pointed to the front door and ran off and I do mean she ran!
reviews.title: A Terrible Stay - I Felt Ripped Off

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: On entering the room we thought it was very dark and we were also aware that, as our room was situated right beside the front door, we would probably hear a lot of noise at night with guests returning. The bed was a bit lumpy and there was no shower in the bathroom, just a bathtub, we weren’t overly impressed.
reviews.title: Perfect .. in every way ..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From 10.30 pm until 5.30 am we did not sleep a wink with guests coming and going and also from the noise of televisions in other guest bedrooms. There is no sound proofing here! We were shattered. We went out to the reception the next morning to ask if they had another room available as we had another night to spend in the hotel. Again, the owner smiled and said that she had expected the extreme noise levels as they had a “big group” staying in the annex where we were. We pressed her again to move us, she relented eventually and moved us to the 3rd floor of this annex. There is no lift in this hotel and the 3rd floor is a good treak up the stairs when carrying bags.
reviews.title: Good with one caveat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delighted with our move, we spent the day going to the beaches and the American cemetery. On our return we were horrified to learn that a cycle race was taking place in Bayeux and that the town was sealed off. We could not return to the hotel with our car. The owner didn’t bother to tell us about this race so we had to park our car well away from the town. We were extremely annoyed. We walked back and asked on reception why we hadn’t been told about this race as we would have come back earlier from our sightseeing had we known, we were told not to worry that we’d be able to move our car at around 10 pm which was 4 hours later!!! There was no attempt made to even consider apologising for not informing us.
reviews.title: Best Location, quiet, quaint - what more could you ask for?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our new room was as bad as the first room, the converted shed backs on to a bar and a lot of drunken people gathered outside singing. This continued til 3am. Other guests were shouting out the window asking these people to stop singing.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel with great rooms, service, food and location - charming!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great little hotel in a beautiful old building. Gorgeous entrance with sweeping steps outside and it is just like stepping back in time into an elegant old house. Staff were lovely very relaxed and welcoming. The room was nice, it doesn't have all the added extras like robes etc that you get in luxurious hotels but then you're not paying anywhere near those prices. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Location is excellent and there is parking (3e a day) and also a lovely little garden out the back. There is a markets on Saturdays in the sq just across from the hotel, don't miss it!
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot fault this hotel in any respect - from check in to check out our stay was absolutely perfect. Although relatively expensive, it is worth every penny and would not hesitate staying here again or recommending it to anyone.
reviews.title: A gem of a hotel in a gem of a city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am in my late 50's and have stayed at hundreds of hotels - this one is in my top ten of all time.
reviews.title: When I die, bury me in the back garden at d'Argouges!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I traveled with my two children (12 and 14 years old) to Paris, Bayeux, and Honfleur. The Hotel d'Argouges was by far our most favorite hotel! Laura and Frederic were so kind and welcoming and helpful! The rooms are lovely, so much larger than our Paris hotel room. The gardens are beautiful, the breakfast was bountiful, and the service was impeccable.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bayeux is a great town -- not only is it beautiful, but I felt very comfortable giving each of my kids 40 Euros and letting them each have 2 hours all alone to roam the shops and ride a bike around town. The people of Bayeux were kind and accommodating and helpful -- they were patient when the children struggled with their French, and always gave us a smile.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, a little pricey, but pretty much as advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel d'Argouges. We had a triple room for two so it was a nice size. It was clean and comfortable. The dining area is very nice and I enjoyed the breakfast room with helpful staff. The garden was also very nice to have a glass of wine and enjoy the scenery at the end of a day of touring. The staff are very helpful and meet all of our needs. I would stay here again and would recommend it to all.
reviews.title: Beautiful Manor house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: I traveled with my husband and sister n law and brother n law to Paris and surrounding areas. We decided to go to Bayeux on the spur of the moment, and I am so glad we did. We got there in the late afternoon and drove around the city looking for a hote. While parked we saw the Hotel d'Agouges across the street and thought we would check it out. It was reasonably priced so we stayed the night. What an experience! Our rooms were beautiful and comfortable, with big wood beams ,criss crossing the rooms and a lovely large bathroom. Breakfast was really good and the room we ate in was so beautiful . It was like being transformed into a past life time. I can honestly say it was one of the best part of our trip. The city of Bayeux was also lovely. People were friendly and we had the most wonderful dinner there. The next morning we went to the American and British cemetries and remembered the fallen men and we are so thankful for all that gave their lives so we had to chance to be the country we are today, with the freedom to speak our minds, and have our opinions and to disagree with our goverment.
reviews.title: The Best Surprise of our Trip !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009
reviews.text: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay at Hotel d'Argouges. The room was spacious, beautifully furnished and very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast had a number of good choices and the waitress was attentive. The parlour room where we ate was beautiful - a lovely tapestry and wall sculptures to contemplate, not to mention the lovely courtyard view. The hotel is within easy walking distance of everything of interest and only 10 minutes from where you catch the tours for the Normandy beaches. We ate a delicious dinner at Dakkar, a restaurant not too many minutes away on the same street. Having the parking right beside the hotel was good - and only 3 Euros a day. We would highly recommend this hotel if you are travelling to Bayeux.
reviews.title: A beautiful, small, very French hotel in the heart of Bayeux

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here based on the high TripAdvisor ratings and weren't disappointed. The entire staff was friendly, and the room was great. Its timber framed room was cozy & charming, and the car park was convenient with a perfect location. You're right across the street from a laundromat, and at the top end of the main street, so you're only a 10 minute walk from all the main shops & restaurants. Add a couple more minutes and you're at the tapestry or cathedral. On the downside, the walls were thin (although I never lost any sleep from it), and the bathtub only had a shower wand but nowhere to hang it, so it made bathing awkward. Otherwise, I had no complaints. Bayeux makes the perfect base for touring Normandy, and this was the perfect hotel to stay at.
reviews.title: We loved Bayeux!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently visited the Normandy region of France and stayed at Hotel d'Argouges. It was really a wonderful place to stay with a great staff and a very nice, quiet location. It is close to good restaurants and easily accessible to the D-Day beaches, walking to the Cathedral and Tapestry, and a great place to stay and drive throughout the Normandy region of France because of the great and easily accessible location. We are from Atlanta, GA in the US and would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Very nice, friendly staff and a lovely place to stay

description: This mansion built by Duc d'Argouges in 1734 is situated in the heart of Bayeux. Beautiful garden, bar, private parking... Perfect location to explore the town and the D-Day Beaches. Recommended by Karen Brown!
